channel.title: GIS on Some Title
channel.description: Recent content in GIS on Some Title

item.title: Convert cubic mesh code to WKT with Python
item.description: Although it is a memorandum level, I created a function to convert the 3rd mesh code to WKT with python. It’s plain, but it tends to be impossible to calculate when it is needed … def toWKTfromMeshCode3(mcode3:'mesh code(str)'):->'wkt(str)' south = (int(mcode3[0:2]) * 80 + int(mcode3[4:5]) * 10 + (int(mcode3[6:7]))) * 30/3600 west = (int(mcode3[2:4]) * 80 + int(mcode3[5:6]) * 10 + (int(mcode3[7:8]))) * 45/3600 + 100 north = south + 30/3600 east = west + 45/3600 wkt ='POLYGON(({e} {n},{w} {n},{w} {s},{e} {s},{e} {n}))'.

item.title: [Python] Plot data for each prefecture on a map (number of cars owned nationwide)
item.description: # Purpose of this article Draw a prefecture-level color-coded map like this in Python For municipal level, go to here By the way, the data used the number of passenger cars owned nationwide. At the end of the page is Code List. Commentary Use the library japanmap to create a colored map pip install japanmap Other library preparation import numpy as np import pandas as pd import cv2 from PIL import Image import matplotlib.
